case_title: MUHAMMAD SHARIF vs MEMBER (REVENUE), BOARD OF REVENUE, PUNJAB, LAHORE AND 2 Others
respondents: Member (Revenue), Board of Revenue, Punjab, Lahore
key_points: Petitioner filed suit for possession of land through right of pre-emption.
Assistant Commissioner decreed the suit on 26-2-1983.
Appellate Authority overturned the decision on 24-6-1984, stating petitioner was a mortgagee, not a tenant.
Revision petition dismissed by Member, Board of Revenue on 31-10-1985.
Supreme Court judgment (P L D 1986 S C 360) declared law granting right of pre-emption to tenants repugnant to Islam.
Government failed to amend the law by the deadline of 31-7-1986, making the Supreme Court decision effective.
legal_analysis: Article 203-H allows continuation of proceedings until law is declared repugnant.
Article 264 does not apply as repeal is legislative, not judicial.
Article 203-A overrides Article 264 in cases of repugnancy to Islamic injunctions.
Objectives Resolution under Article 2-A emphasizes establishment of Islamic society.
final_reasoning: Petitioner sought enforcement of a law that ceased to have effect under Article 203-D(3)(b). Writ petition dismissed as law is no longer valid.
